Description: Body sherd (mended from six fragments, including 1924,1201.260 and 287) of Chian Mature Animal Style pottery heavy chalice with cul; white slip; interior: glazed streaky black; above, part of lotus in added white outline with added red centre, above two white lines; at level of cul, two more white lines; exterior: trace of two lines near lip; below, painted decoration consisting of frieze of sphinxes to left (from left, part of rump and tail of first sphinx; at right, foreparts of second sphinx with red patches on wing and body); elaborate rosette, rising roundel, part of pendant roundel and short vertical strokes as filling ornament; on cul below, double guilloche pattern and vertical dividing band with maeander pattern and horizontal strokes between bands.
Curator's comments: The sherd joins British Museum 1924,1201.260 and 1924,1201.287. For parallels regarding the exterior decoration and shape, compare the sherd with British Museum 1888,0601.474.a, which Lemos describes as belonging to the Group of Elaborate Animal Chalices because it is a large and heavy-walled chalice-krater. Chalices in this group display elaborate compositions that include polychromy and delicately painted figures (Lemos 1991, 90-1). British Museum 1888,0601.474.b could also be included in this group.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1580) (phase 2)
